title: jit, instantiating zero element tensor with device results in error
body_html:
🐛 Bug

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

  1. Example code:
import torch

from torch.jit import script

@script
def zero_elem_tensor():
    return torch.empty([0], device=[0])


zero_elem_tensor()

Error:
RuntimeError: elems.size() == 2 ASSERT FAILED at /pytorch/aten/src/ATen/core/ivalue.h:489, please report a bug to PyTorch. (to<at::Device> at /pytorch/aten/src/ATen/core/ivalue.h:489)

Expected behavior

Creates the tensor, as it does without jit: torch.empty([0], device=torch.device('cuda'))

Environment

PyTorch version: 1.0.0.dev20181008
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 9.2.148

OS: Arch Linux
GCC version: (GCC) 8.2.1 20180831
CMake version: version 3.12.3

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: 10.0.130
GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti
Nvidia driver version: 410.66
cuDNN version: Could not collect

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] Could not collect
[conda] Could not collect

  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pipenv

Additional context

I have little experience with jit.

body:
## 🐛 Bug

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Example code:

```python
import torch

from torch.jit import script

@script
def zero_elem_tensor():
    return torch.empty([0], device=[0])


zero_elem_tensor()
```
Error:
`RuntimeError: elems.size() == 2 ASSERT FAILED at /pytorch/aten/src/ATen/core/ivalue.h:489, please report a bug to PyTorch. (to<at::Device> at /pytorch/aten/src/ATen/core/ivalue.h:489)`

<!-- If you have a code sample, error messages, stack traces, please provide it here as well -->

## Expected behavior

Creates the tensor, as it does without jit: `torch.empty([0], device=torch.device('cuda'))`

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

## Environment


PyTorch version: 1.0.0.dev20181008
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 9.2.148

OS: Arch Linux
GCC version: (GCC) 8.2.1 20180831
CMake version: version 3.12.3

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: 10.0.130
GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti
Nvidia driver version: 410.66
cuDNN version: Could not collect

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] Could not collect
[conda] Could not collect

 - How you installed PyTorch (`conda`, `pip`, source): pipenv

## Additional context
I have little experience with jit.

<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->
